New Records: LeBron James tied Vince Carter's record for the most seasons played in the NBA at 22.
Pre-Game Insights: LeBron James spoke about how much Bronny's presence on the team means to him, saying it's a 'pure joy' to work with his son every day and see him grow.
Post-Match Reflections: LeBron James expressed his joy in playing alongside his son, Bronny James, and tying an NBA record for most seasons played.
Miscellaneous Highlights: This was the first regular-season game under new head coach JJ Redick for the LA Lakers.
LeBron James is the league's oldest active player, and only five players were aged 39 or older on opening night.
Others: LeBron James' stats from the game: 16 points, five rebounds, and four assists in nearly 35 minutes of play.
